sections.content:
This module provides a collection of lightweight UI components designed for use within a notebook page.

For layout-specific elements, refer to the  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/notebook/Views/Layouts" semantic="module">Layouts</mkapi-api-link>  submodule.

## Quick Overview

###  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/notebook/Views.Select" semantic="class">Select</mkapi-api-link> 

The  `Select`  component provides a **selectable list** with customizable display names.

<js-cell>
let select = new Views.Select({
    items: {foo:42, bar:84},
    selected: 'foo',
    displayedNames: { 'foo': 'Foo', 'bar': 'Bar'}
})
display(select)
display(select.value$)
</js-cell>

###  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/notebook/Views.Range" semantic="class">Range</mkapi-api-link> 

The  `Range`  component creates an **interactive slider** for numeric input.

<js-cell>
let range = new Views.Range()
display(range)
display(range.value$)
</js-cell>

###  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/notebook/Views.Text" semantic="class">Text</mkapi-api-link> 

The  `Text`  component supports **Markdown formatting** and **LaTeX expressions** for mathematical notation.

<js-cell>
display(new Views.Text('**a simple example**'))
display(new Views.Text(String.raw `**including latex inlined**: \(ax^2 + bx + c = 0\)` ))
display(new Views.Text(String.raw `**including latex block**: $$x = {-b \pm \sqrt{b^2-4ac} \over 2a}$$` ))
</js-cell>

###  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/notebook/Views.notify" semantic="function">Notification</mkapi-api-link> 

The  `notify`  function enables notification:

<js-cell>
const notification = {
    tag: 'div',
    class: 'p-3',
    innerText: 'A notification...'
}
display({
    tag: 'button',
    class: 'btn btn-sm btn-primary',
    innerText: 'Notify',
    onclick: ()=> {
        Views.notify({content:notification, level:'info', duration:3000})
    }
})
</js-cell>

Represents a range view.

<js-cell>
let range = new Views.Range()
display(range)
display(range.value$)
</js-cell>

To set up min, max and step:
<js-cell>
display(new Views.Range({min:0, max:100, step: 1}))
</js-cell>

The range can optionally **not** emit while dragging:
<js-cell>
range = new Views.Range({emitDrag: false})
display(range)
</js-cell>

<note level='info'>
When emitting on drag, it may be relevant to debounce the values, *e.g.*:

 `range.value$.pipe(rxjs.debounceTime(100))` .

</note>
Children of the element.
Classes associated to the view.
If  `true` , data are emitted in  `value$`  while dragging the slider.
Maximum value.
Minimum value.
Step.
Style attributes.
The tag of the element, equivalent to the  `tagName`  property of  `HTMLElement` .
Default value.
Children of the element.
Classes associated to the view.
Observable on the current item's ID.
The tag of the element, equivalent to the  `tagName`  property of  `HTMLElement` .
Observable on the current value.

Represents a text view.

The text provided is interpreted as MarkDown and can include latex equations.

<js-cell>
display(new Views.Text('**a simple example**'))
display(new Views.Text(String.raw `**including latex inlined**: \(ax^2 + bx + c = 0\)` ))
display(new Views.Text(String.raw `**including latex block**: $$x = {-b \pm \sqrt{b^2-4ac} \over 2a}$$` ))
</js-cell>

Fine-tuning of element's class & style is also possible.
Children of the element.

Classes associated to the view.
Can be completed from constructor.
Lifecycle hook called just after the element has been attached to the document's DOM.

Style elements.
Can be completed from constructor.
The tag of the element, equivalent to the  `tagName`  property of  `HTMLElement` .

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content:
*  **content**: The content to display in the notification.
*  **done$**: Optional observable that, when emitting, removes the notification.
*  **duration**: Optional duration in milliseconds after which the notification will automatically disappear.
